meanings.definition: Unwillingness or hesitation to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her reluctancy to try new foods made dinner time a challenge.
meanings.sent2: His reluctancy to speak in public often held him back from sharing his ideas.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed reluctancy to enter the bathtub for a bath.
meanings.sent4: The tree's reluctancy to shed its leaves signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The child's reluctancy to let go of the balloon resulted in tears when it flew away.

meanings.sent1: The team's reluctancy to accept defeat motivated them to train harder.
meanings.sent2: She could sense the reluctancy in his voice when he agreed to help.
meanings.sent3: The reluctancy of the clock to strike midnight amused the party guests.
meanings.sent4: The reluctancy of the river to freeze over hinted at the early arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The reluctancy of the old car to start on cold mornings was a familiar frustration.
